Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.professor_prompt: Should schools provide students with the opportunity of learning literature and analyzing fictional texts, or should they focus solely on scientific and practical subjects?
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.student_1_response: In my point of view, I believe that the school should also provide students with the opportunity of learning literature and analyzing fictional texts. First, it is true that students who have chosen scientific fields of study could easily find their ideal occupations in the future, but studying literature would also enable students to find a wide range of jobs. For example, literature majors could choose to become editors or writers in the publishers; they could also choose to become reporters because they are more skillful in delivering messages of ideas orally; they could also become teachers and impart knowledge to other students. Therefore, studying literature would also help students find suitable jobs in the future. Besides, learning fictional texts would enable students to develop a good reading habit, increasing their interest in terms of reading books.

Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.professor_prompt: Let's discuss the skills most needed by people who want to start and run their own business. Some experts propose that future businesspeople should focus on improving their sales techniques —after all, if you cannot sell your product, you will soon be out of business. Others believe that these future businesspeople would benefit most from learning management skills, such as how to lead teams and motivate employees. Which view do you agree with? Why?
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.student_1_response: I think that management skills are most important. Sales tasks are something that a businessperson can delegate to a team of salespeople once the business gets going, so it is really important that the future businessperson develops skills to manage teams of people. Without that, it is not very likely that the business will grow.
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.student_2_response: Learning how to sell your product is the most essential task. I've read about people who had ideas about exciting new products to build a business around. They borrowed capital and started their business, but they could not explain to the public what made the products exciting. Since they could not sell enough products, their business failed.
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.folder_name: Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techniques Or Management Skills？
Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techni.original_image_file: Businesspeople Should Learn Sales Techniques Or Management Skills？.png

Children's Caring for Pets.professor_prompt: Keeping and caring for pet animals (for example, cats, dogs, and birds) is a human behavior we see in most cultures. Often it is children who ask to keep and care for a pet of their own, or who share the responsibility of caring for a pet with other family members. In your opinion, do children gain important benefits from caring for a pet animal? Why or why not?
Children's Caring for Pets.student_1_response: I can think of one clear benefit. When you read interviews with famous scientists, especially biologists, you learn that their interest in science was often awakened because they had a pet animal or animals as children. Playing with the animals and observing them led those people to develop an interest in natural science.
Children's Caring for Pets.student_2_response: I think there often isn't any real benefit. What typically happens, unfortunately, is that parents get a pet animal for their child because the child likes animals in books or films. But when they have to take care of a real animal, those children lose interest, and it's the parents who end up taking care of it.

The Best Way to Make New Friends.professor_prompt: In our class this week, we are going to talk about the importance of friendship to each individual. As we all know, humans are social creatures. Making new friends can be difficult in certain circumstances, but there are many successful ways to make friends, of course. What do you think is the best way to make new friends and why do you think so?
The Best Way to Make New Friends.student_1_response: Volunteering is a good way to make new friends. Recently our city's Beautification Committee asked for volunteers to plant flowers around the downtown square, to make it more appealing for residents and visitors. I joined a dozen others in that activity. While we worked, we had the opportunity to talk and get to know each other.
The Best Way to Make New Friends.student_2_response: I have made a few good friends by taking a class at the local library. It was a class in stamp collecting, and I met some very interesting people. The key is to stay in touch after the class is over, do additional activities together, and make an effort to build a friendship. We just had lunch together today.

Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.professor_prompt: This week, we've been discussing ways to protect the environment. One way is to require companies to pay penalties, such as higher taxes or large fines, when they pollute and damage the environment. We're going to explore this topic in depth tomorrow, but first I'd like to get your thoughts: Do you think imposing these taxes and fines would be a good way to stop companies from harming the environment? Why or why not?
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.student_1_response: I don't think it will be effective. Where I live, the local government imposes fines on polluting companies, but it doesn't stop them. I know of one business that created a lot of water pollution. Instead of changing their ways, they just paid a fine. No one was really punished, and the pollution is still a problem.
Imposing Taxes and Fines to Stop Compani.student_2_response: I think it's an excellent idea. As long as there is no penalty for polluting the environment, these companies will not bother searching for alternatives to practices that contribute to air, water, or land pollution. And it should be a financial penalty because every company worries about money.

Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.student_1_response: From my point of view, it's not a good idea to pursue an advanced degree while continuing to work full-time. First of all, for students, studying at universities while working will have a negative impact on both their academic progress and their work at companies. To receive an advanced degree, students must take a number of challenging courses, and they will undoubtedly become extremely overwhelmed if they have a full-time job as well. This great amount of pressure will not only affect their academic performance but also influence their work. For instance, students like this may be asked to contact their customers the day before the exam, and circumstances like that will surely impose a great deal of pressure on them, or even further causing anxiety. In addition, it's not good for companies as well. Since students in the companies who still have to take classes at universities are not able to do as much work as other employers, recruiting students who are taking advanced degrees to work will decrease the companies' efficiency, which will eventually harm the profit.
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.folder_name: Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working Full-time？

Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be discussing the future of education. Let's focus now on the following viewpoint: it is no longer useful to spend many years pursuing a traditional, specialized university degree in a single field, such as communications or economics. Instead, it makes more sense for most people to complete several shorter certification programs and earn certificates in, for example, project management, computer programming, graphic design, and so on. Do you agree or disagree with this viewpoint? Why?
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.student_1_response: I agree that completing short certification programs makes a lot of sense these days because people are more likely to change careers now than they were in the past. Certification programs allow people to quickly learn a variety of professional skills that are in demand at the moment. And acquiring such skills leads to more job opportunities.
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.student_2_response: I see the advantages of earning certificates, but I don't think that they can completely replace university degrees. Certification programs provide only superficial knowledge, while university degrees offer a well-developed and organized approach to studying. By pursuing university degrees, students gain foundational knowledge and a broader understanding of their field of study and develop many skills as well.
Several Shorter Certification Or A Unive.folder_name: Several Shorter Certification Or A University Degree？

The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.professor_prompt: To continue our discussion on adopting an environmentally friendly lifestyle, let's explore the role that individuals can play in keeping the Earth as clean as possible. Recycling is the most common action taken to help keep the environment clean, but studies show that recycling alone is not enough. Other than recycling, what is one action that a person could take that would have the greatest impact on protecting the environment? Why?
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.student_1_response: It might be better to pay more attention when we are shopping and to avoid purchasing items that aren't environmentally friendly, such as single-use plastic items. Doing so would save time and energy because we will not have to recycle anything, and it might even leave us with more time to help the environment in other ways.
The Greatest Impact on Protecting Enviro.student_2_response: People should try to prevent pollution just like Kelly suggests, but it might be better to first address the pollution that already exists in our environment. If people plant trees and shrubs in their yards or in the local parks, these trees and shrubs might absorb pollutants that we breathe in and help to clean the air in our cities.

The Most Important Subject.professor_prompt: In your opinion, what qualities or characteristics should universities look for when admitting students? Explain your reasoning using specific details and examples.
The Most Important Subject.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that students who are at the top of their class and did not have to work hard for their achievements would be more successful in the long run.
The Most Important Subject.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that students who work hard and overcome challenges to achieve their goals would be more successful in the long run.

Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.student_1_response: From my point of view, young children shouldn't be exposed to online videos. First of all, watching online videos is not good for children's eyes. Since young children's eyes are still not fully developed and sensitive to long-term exposure to screens, the use of electronic devices will increase the risk of shortsightedness for young children, which will be clearly a significant drawback for their future life. Although some may argue that young children should be allowed to watch educational videos, the truth is that children's eye will be harmed by the screen of electronic devices regardless of what video they watch. In addition, addition to electronic devices is another crucial problem. Nowadays lots of apps have the mechanism that could send you the video that you'd like to watch, and children are likely to become indulged in it since their self-discipline skills are still not fully developed.
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.folder_name: Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Children？

Effects of Society Progress Happening To.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that this progress is happening too fast and could have serious concerns. First, because these new technologies are not well developed yet, many negative impacts that people haven't thought about could exist. Our development of technology happened just a few hundred years ago, and it is still developing in a very fast speed. These will raise many concerns such as environmental issues, things could damage human health such as radiation and many more. Just like what happened during the Industrial Revolution, when people couldn't foresee the impact of greenhouse gases. Therefore, these underdeveloped and new technologies would cause more damage to people in the future if these rate isn't going to slow down. Furthermore, conflicts caused by technology are increasing, too. Due to the production of more variety of products, more and more resources are needed, which further forces the countries to fight over a certain raw material. For example, the conflict element, which are rare elements that are located in less developed countries causes forced labor, war, and serious human rights issues.

What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.professor_prompt: This week we will discuss issues faced by secondary school administrators. I'm referring to schools for teenage students. One such issue is students who change schools. Students change schools for many different reasons, the most common being a family move. On the discussion board, I want you to exchange ideas about what schools can do to make the transition to a new school easier for teenagers.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.student_1_response: I think schools should assign new students a fellow student who can help them adjust. The student buddy can do things like make sure the new student can find the cafeteria or the right classrooms. For new students, it's a lot easier to ask a fellow student a question rather than ask a teacher or the principal.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.student_2_response: I would require new students to sign up for some school club or activity that meets outside of class. That way, new students would have an easy way to meet other students in a friendly environment. It would give them a group to immediately identify with.
What Schools Can Do to Make Transition t.folder_name: What Schools Can Do to Make Transition to A New School Easier

Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.professor_prompt: In today's discussion, we'll explore the following question: Some people believe that the government should tax fuel (like gasoline) heavily and use the revenue to subsidize electricity costs for homes and businesses. Others argue that this approach is not effective. What is your opinion on this policy?
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.student_1_response: I believe that taxing fuel and using the revenue to subsidize electricity is a reasonable policy approach. By making fuel more expensive, the government can encourage people to reduce their fuel consumption, which would help protect the environment. Additionally, subsidizing electricity costs would make it more affordable for families and businesses to use energy. This could be especially helpful for low-income households that struggle to pay their electricity bills.
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.student_2_response: While I understand the reasoning behind this policy, I think it may not be the most effective approach. Taxing fuel heavily could place a significant financial burden on people who rely on vehicles for their daily commute or work, such as delivery drivers or construction workers. Instead, the government should invest in extra training programs for workers in fossil fuel industries to help them transition to cleaner energy jobs. This would address environmental concerns while also supporting affected workers.
Governments Encourage More Use of Electr.folder_name: Governments Encourage More Use of Electric Vehicles

What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.professor_prompt: In this unit, we will be learning about effective strategies for increasing student motivation. Let's begin by discussing one common concern shared by many high school teachers: some of their students, typically aged 14 to 18, seem to be bored or uninterested in learning. In your view, what strategy should teachers use to increase high school students' interest in learning? Please explain why you think this one particular strategy will be effective.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.student_1_response: I believe teachers should incorporate more group work activities into their lessons. While completing tasks in groups or teams, students will have an opportunity to share their opinions and learn from their peers. Having a sense of belonging is important to teenagers, so being part of a team will likely make them more interested in learning.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.student_2_response: In my opinion, teachers should explain how the lessons they teach in the classroom have a connection to events in the world outside high school. Students will likely become more interested in learning once they understand that the lessons can help them be better prepared for future university studies and work.
What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Inc.folder_name: What Strategy Should Teachers Use to Increase High School Students' Interest in Learning

Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.professor_prompt: In class this week, we are looking at how markets work, particularly in regard to energy costs. Petroleum, also known simply as oil, is one of the most important international commodities. When the global market price of oil goes up, fuels such as gasoline (petrol) also become more expensive. Many people think governments should step in to protect consumers from increases in fuel prices. What is your view? Do you think governments should actively keep fuel prices low for consumers?
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.student_1_response: I think it's a good government policy. Most people have to drive or use public transportation, like a bus, to get to work. When the price of gasoline goes up, it costs them more to get to work. People don't have a choice about whether to go to work or not, so they should be protected from price increases.
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.student_2_response: I think the government keeping gas prices low is a bad policy. The biggest problem we face now is global climate change. The more expensive gasoline is, the less people will drive, and thus they will contribute fewer greenhouse gases to the air. Lowering the cost of gas just makes the problem worse.
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.folder_name: Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low
Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.original_image_file: Government Should Keep Fuel Prices Low.png

TV or books.student_1_response: From my perspective, TV has a greater impact on people's live in today's world. To begin with, more people prefer watching TV. Nowadays, with the development of Internet, almost everyone has a television in his or her home. During the free time, all people would choose watching TV as their best way of finding relaxation because it contains variety of recreational channels like argument channel, cartoon channel, shopping channel and so on. Through browsing through the TV, people sooth their pressure. On the contrary, reading books tend to further take people's energy because it's impossible to read without thinking, making it less appeal when it comes to free time. Besides, TV could benefit people's real life. Many of the TV channels contain advertisements, which are likely to encounter people's need. For example, my uncle has found his job when he noticed the employment advertisement on TV. However, books could not provide such realistic aid, but instead, they tend to be merely a form of escaping from the reality by indulging into a fictional world.

Living in One Town or City All Your Life.topic: Living in One Town/City vs. Moving
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.professor_prompt: Today, I'd like to discuss choices people make in terms of where they decide to live. Some people choose to spend their entire lives in one town or city. Others leave their hometowns and might even move several times from one town or city to another. I'd like to get your thoughts on this subject. Do you think it is better to live in one town or city all your life? Why or why not?
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.student_1_response: Living in one place your whole life is the better option. It allows you to form strong bonds with neighbors and members of your community. You know that if you stay in one place for a long time, you will always have friends you can rely on when you need help.

Poor Eating Habit to Change.student_2_response: Expanding on Kelly's view, I think, generally, every meal should be treated seriously. As food delivery and fast-food industry are so convenient today, a lot of people order food delivery or cheap fast-food just to save time and money. However, this brings a series of problems in the long run: those food from commercialized companies often involves unhealthy oil and ingredients which adds heavy burdens on our digestive system and even blood circulation; moreover, those foods are often cold and simple dishes that provides limited nutrition to our body. Therefore, if this habit continues over a period of time, our body would suffer from serious digestive problems and nutrition shortages, which would then lead to further illnesses. A great way to improve this bad habit is to buy fresh ingredient and cook on daily basis. Though it takes much more time to set up and prepare, it brings significant change to our health as a whole, whilst also increases our sense of accomplishment once we've acquired this new skill to a healthy life style.

Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.topic: Online Classes vs Traditional In-Person Classes in Education
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.professor_prompt: In the next few weeks, we'll be discussing different learning options and their respective benefits and drawbacks. Let's focus now on online classes, which are becoming more and more popular. In online classes, students communicate with their professors and other students completely online. Do you think that online classes offer advantages to both students and teachers that make them preferable to traditional in-person classes? Why or why not?
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.student_1_response: I believe online classes are preferable to traditional face-to-face classes, both for students and teachers. Because online classes allow more flexibility (for example, in terms of location and time), they better accommodate students and teachers with busy schedules. The quality of online classes has considerably improved, so online classes now present excellent learning options.
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.student_2_response: Online classes don't have any advantages over traditional in-person classes. What's important is how good the teacher is. An online class won't be any good if the instructor isn't a talented teacher. But an online class can be effective if the teacher knows how to teach and how to use online resources. Teacher competence is what matters most.
Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person.folder_name: Online Classes, Or Traditional In-person Classes？

Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.topic: Teaching Methods: Lecturing vs. Interactive Activities
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.professor_prompt: In your opinion, is lecturing an effective teaching method? Explain why or why not, using specific reasons and examples.
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that lecturing is an effective teaching method. To begin with, lecturing could be very efficient in conveying knowledge. When a teacher explains a topic, continuity would be very important, which could help the students to link those points together. Discussing one whole part would also help the students to feel more excited by slowly revealing the connections. For example, when studying biology class, the students will be excited to understand how DNA would link to the production of protein and further to how life functions. If there are constant interruptions caused by activities, it would be very unhelpful for the students' understanding because of the gap between each point. Furthermore, students would learn important skills while listening to lectures. Lectures require students to have self-learning skills and fast interpretation, which would be essential for their future studies. Therefore, using this lecturing method would benefit students and help them to be more efficient while they are learning other concepts and picking up the points quickly.
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.folder_name: Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Method？

New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.topic: Educational Policy - New Courses in Public Schools
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.professor_prompt: This week we are studying how policy for public schools is created and how it may change over time. One very important topic for educational policy involves what courses should be taught in schools. Many people believe that new forms of communication and new kinds of employment require that new and different kinds of courses be taught. The question I want you to discuss is whether new, innovative subjects should be taught in public schools.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.student_1_response: I definitely think there should be new kinds of courses taught in public schools. For instance, people communicate more and more on the Internet by sharing photographs and videos with each other. I think a course in video composition—that is, how to make good and effective videos—would be really valuable to today's students. And there are many other similar topics that students might benefit from.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.student_2_response: I really don't think the high school curriculum needs to change. The main purpose of most courses in high school is to prepare students for higher education, and those basic requirements haven't changed. If students want to learn other things, like how to compose photographs or edit films, they can watch instructional videos on the Internet. They don't need a class in school to learn things like that.
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.folder_name: New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taught in Public Schools
New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taugh.original_image_file: New, Innovative Subjects Should Be Taught in Public Schools.JPG

Financial Support to Artists.professor_prompt: We've been discussing government budgets and the difficult decisions governments must make regarding the use of public funds. Some services are clearly essential and must be paid for by any government. But what about public funding of the arts? Do you believe that governments should provide financial support to artists—for example, painters, sculptors, musicians, or filmmakers? Why or why not?
Financial Support to Artists.student_1_response: I enjoy art as much as anyone does, but public funds come from taxes, and I don't think taxpayers' hard-earned money should be spent on impractical or inessential items and services. Artists should support themselves by selling their work to private individuals and companies. If they can't find enough buyers, then maybe they should change careers.
Financial Support to Artists.student_2_response: Personally, I think art actually is essential. Lots of public spaces in my hometown just wouldn't be the same without artwork. From statues in public parks to murals painted on the walls of government buildings, my hometown really benefits from funding the artists who created these works. The public spaces are simply more enjoyable for visitors because of the artwork.

Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.professor_prompt: Should governments and businesses share their scientific discoveries with each other?
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.student_1_response: In many opinion, I believe that governments and business all over the world should share their scientific discoveries with each other. To begin with, the action of sharing scientific information would contribute to a faster development of the whole society. Many scientists would spend numerous hours working in their labs to conduct researches and wait for the results; however, if other researchers have already finished the same kind of experiment upon same subjects, it would save other scientists a great deal of time if the outcome of the experiment is to be shared. Therefore, all scientists could have more time focusing on more pressing subjects and topics. Second, such behavior would also encourage more people to participate in scientific world, since a lot of data and key information are easily available in the shared community.
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.folder_name: Governments Should Not Keep Scientific Discoveries Secret

Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.topic: Hiring Experienced Workers vs. Young Workers
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.professor_prompt: Should companies hire experienced workers or young workers? Discuss the advantages and disadvantages of each option.
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.student_1_response: From my perspective, I believe that company should employ experienced workers. The main reason is that hiring experienced workers could benefit companies more than hiring young ones. Hiring young workers who have no experience would lead to the cost on training. Young workers must undergo training for at least several weeks before they could formally participate in company's project, which is both time and money consuming. However, experienced workers don't need such training since they have been trained before in previous jobs, rendering them more adaptive and productive, and therefore reducing the cost. Moreover, experienced workers are more likely to be sophisticated in negotiating with their colleagues because they have contacted with variety of people in previous jobs, equipping them with excellent ability to cooperate and get on well with others. On the contrary, young workers are usually not mature enough to be as sophisticated as those experienced workers, which may lead to problems when it comes to the collaboration within the company. For example, immature young workers may begin a fierce argument with his or her colleagues, which would definitely impede the cooperation and therefore reduce the working efficiency.
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.folder_name: Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Employees

Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.topic: Living in Rural vs Urban Areas
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.professor_prompt: [Professor prompt not visible in OCR text]
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.student_1_name: [Student name not visible in OCR text]
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe there are several reasons why people would prefer to live in rural areas in the modern time. To begin with, the living cost or expense of people dwelling in rural areas is far less than that of people in big cities. For those who have settled in metropolis, they would have so many things to worry about: high rent, commuting cost, increasing housing prices, or even higher item prices in grocery stores. However, for people choosing to live in the countryside, they would not have to rack their brains to deal with all those high living costs everyday, which, from my perspective, is the main reason why many people start settling down in the rural areas. In addition, regions in rural areas are indeed less polluted and the air quality there is much better than that in cities. Many factories have been emitting pollutants into the air or even river for many years, leading to lower air quality in cities: hazy days are very common in major cities in recent years.

Environmental Tax on Air Travel.professor_prompt: Should governments impose an environmental tax on air travel to reduce carbon emissions?
Environmental Tax on Air Travel.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that imposing environmental tax on air travel is unnecessary. To begin with, adding an environmental tax on air travel would lead to serious implications to both air travel companies as well as individual passengers. After imposing the environmental tax on airline companies, these companies would have to pay additional fees to the government. In order to compensate such extra cost, the companies might have to raise the price of the airplane tickets, creating additional financial burden for passengers. Besides, higher ticket price might discourage passengers from using airplane as a means of transportation, which would in turn hurt the profits of airline business, leading to high unemployment rate or lower salaries for workers in those companies. Besides, imposing more environmental tax would not allow planes to burn less fossil fuel, which is the main cause for air pollution!

Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.student_1_response: For me, a closer, smaller social circle is better. The first reason is that small social circles foster close emotion supports. In a large social group, since everyone has to maintain their relationship with other group members, the opportunity of close communication between each team members will be very small. As a result, close emotional connection are not likely to form between team members in a large team. However, in a small social group, each team member will have enough time and chance to understand others, and whenever who needs an emotional support, other members could easily help him or her. In addition, living in a smaller group is more relaxing. Since we only need to contact a few members in a small social circle, the pressure of living in that group will be much less comparing to a large group, and we will be more relaxed as well.
Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.folder_name: Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A Larger Group of Friends

Career or Relationships Imapcting Happin.student_1_response: I believe that one's career has a larger impact on overall happiness. Using Cash to Make Purchase.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that a decrease in using cash is negative. Nowadays, many elderly people are having trouble understanding the usage of simple electronics due to the development of technology at a rapid speed. Because of this decrease in the use of cash, many sellers also started adapting and stopped accepting cash. Old people would have a hard time navigating the app and payment, and this could cause them to feel powerless and feel that their lack of ability further damages their mental well-being. Moreover, putting all the money on apps or cards would have risks. Due to the development of technology, online scamming is getting more and more popular. People could be hacked or accidentally leaking their personal information, which could cause them to lose all their money because of that. This could be very damaging to one's mental, and physical well-being.
Using Cash to Make Purchase.student_2_response: The second student's response is not visible in the provided OCR text.

Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.topic: Government Funding Allocation (Facilities vs Art Museums)
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.professor_prompt: In your opinion, what should the government spend money on: facilities like playgrounds and public swimming pools, or art museums?
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.student_1_response: From my perspective, the money should be spent on facilities like playgrounds and public swimming pools. The main reason is that such fund would generate economic benefit. Nowadays, facilities are considered as one of the most imperative factors when it comes to the choice of residence. Many people would choose the city with premium facilities as their ideal living place because those facilities could guarantee living standard. If the government provides fund to a city's facility, it would make the city a tremendously appealing place to work and live, attracting sufficient labors to promote local economy. Besides, the increasing quality of facilities may improve tourism, further developing economic growth. On the contrary, funding art museums may not have such an obvious impact on the economy, since fewer people are interested in arts due to the higher level of pressure that people bear in modern life.
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.folder_name: Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, Or Playgrounds and Public Swimming Pools

Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.professor_prompt: In the past, it was common for people to stay at one job for a long time, possibly for their whole career. This has changed in recent years, though, and nowadays many people tend to change jobs quite often. Proponents of this job market trend point to many benefits of regularly changing careers. Today, I would like to know what you think. Do you agree that the benefits of switching jobs often outweigh the disadvantages? Why or why not?
Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.student_1_response: I believe that it can be beneficial for people to change jobs often. If you do the same job for a long time (for example, several years), you might become too comfortable with the job. This could mean the job is no longer challenging for you and it could cause you to be bored and unsatisfied at work.
Benefits of Switching Jobs Often.student_2_response: I agree with some of what Paul wrote, but we also need to consider the disadvantages of changing jobs often. Switching jobs can make you feel insecure and exhausted, especially if you are changing fields and have to learn new skills. Additionally, you have to adapt to a new environment and new colleagues, which can be overwhelming as well.

The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.folder_name: The Most Important Criteria for Promotion

Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.student_1_response: From my point of view, online shopping has a positive influence on society overall. First of all, online shopping can enhance the economy. Online shopping allows customers to make purchases at their home rather than going to shops in person, and people will be more motivated to buy products online since the effort they need to spend on taking a walk to shops is saved. As a result, the economy will be enhanced by the online shopping services. For instance, readers may be reluctant to buy new books that are sold only in bookstores that are far away from them, but problems like that won't exist if they could buy them online. In addition, online shopping can save time for people. Since they don't need to travel to the physical stores to buy products, the time on the road will be saved, which will allow people to spend more time on other things, including academic works or pursuing their own interest.

What Approach That Governments Can Use t.professor_prompt: Let's think about population trends in urban and rural areas (villages). Living in urban areas can be expensive; nonetheless, when they have a choice of where to live, people in some countries do not wish to live in rural areas even if the cost of living there is lower. If governments of some countries want to attract more people to live in rural areas or villages, what is the best strategy or approach that governments can use? Why?
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.student_1_response: I would live in a rural area if the government gave more financial help to farmers. Although it may cost very little to live in a rural area, it costs a lot to begin a career in agriculture. If I had financial help, I would start my own farm and be happy to live in a rural area.
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.student_2_response: In my country, urban centers are great places to live because you can access shops, restaurants, and museums. If the government of my country wanted to attract me to live in a rural area, the area would first have to attract more businesses focused on entertainment and culture than most rural areas have now.
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.folder_name: What Approach That Governments Can Use to Attract More People to Live in Rural Areas
What Approach That Governments Can Use t.original_image_file: What Approach That Governments Can Use to Attract More People to Live in Rural Areas.jpg

Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.topic: Social Phenomenon of Not Helping Others
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.professor_prompt: One social phenomenon we discussed recently is this: when a person is in some trouble, some people help that person, while many others do nothing. Some people conclude that inaction— that is, doing nothing—makes the world a worse place. In your post, please discuss the causes or the effects of this social phenomenon; in other words, what are some reasons why people might choose not to help others, or what are some results of this inaction?
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.student_1_response: In my opinion, one of the main causes behind this phenomenon of people not helping others is concern for one's own interests. If I come across someone in a situation who needs help, I will want to help that person—but not if it creates some significant problem for me. Doing so will simply put us both in a bad situation.
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.student_2_response: I agree that inaction makes the world worse. That means that we all have the responsibility to make the world a better place. An important effect of people not taking on this responsibility is that we may feel less trusting of our neighbors. Conversely, when others show that they are willing to help people, our community becomes stronger.
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.folder_name: Why People Choose Not To Help Others - Inaction
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.original_image_file: Why People Choose Not To Help Others - Inaction.png

School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.topic: School Curriculum: Foundational Knowledge vs. Creative Subjects
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.professor_prompt: What should children be learning in school? Many people believe that time in the classroom should be spent acquiring foundational knowledge in subjects like math, reading, science, and history. Others feel that it's important for a child's creativity to be nurtured, and thus the school curriculum must include classes in art and music. There's so much to learn, yet so little time in school to learn it all! What do you think should be included in the curriculum? Why?
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.student_1_response: I agree that traditional subjects like math, science, and reading are important, but so are classes in art and music. Engaging with art and music can help children be more creative and can stimulate their imaginations. That in turn facilitates critical thinking, which is essential in any curriculum, so I am in favor of including art and music in the school day.
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.student_2_response: Sure, drawing pictures and listening to music is fun, but children can do that on their own time. The school day is too short as it is, and there is so much foundational knowledge in math, reading, science, and history that children need to learn; it is better to spend classroom time on that foundational knowledge and let kids explore art and music at home.
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.folder_name: School Curriculum Must Include Classes in Art and Music
School Curriculum Must Include Classes i.original_image_file: School Curriculum Must Include Classes in Art and Music.png

Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.student_1_response: As far as I'm concerned, governments should charge drivers for certain amount of fees to drive during rush hours. To begin with, as is known to all, traffic congestion is a serious social problem nowadays and many drivers are stuck on the road for a long time. By setting such a rule, many people will consider a lot before deciding whether they will drive their private cars or not. In this way, many citizens, especially the relatively less wealthy ones, will probably select an alternate way of transportation, such as the subway, due to their heavy financial burden. Moreover, the governments can earn money to solve the rushing hour problem more directly. For example, the government can use their budget to build additional roads in the city to support multiple choices for drivers in order to relieve traffic congestion.
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.folder_name: Government Should Charge Drivers Fees for Driving during Rush Hour？

The Most Important Action for Leaders to.professor_prompt: In your opinion, what should a country's leaders do to improve the country's economic prosperity?
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe making housing more affordable is an excellent idea for a country's leaders to take to improve the country's economic prosperity. To begin with, the current housing price has imposed too much pressure on the majority of the public, especially for people aged between 25 to 40. These middle-aged people would have to spend most of their time earning money, and save it for the down-payment of their houses or for their house loans. This means that such group of people would not make many purchases in their daily life, meaning that they are not contributing to the commercial market. When money is not circulating on the market, the prosperity of a country will necessarily decline. Therefore, in order to improve other industries of a country, housing price needs to be kept low enough.
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.folder_name: The Most Important Action for Leaders to Improve Country's Prosperity

Participation in Team Sports Important f.topic: Role of Team Sports in Child Development
Participation in Team Sports Important f.professor_prompt: Let's discuss the role that being on a sports team plays in a child's development. Many argue that playing a team sport, such as basketball, football, or baseball, is an important experience that all children can benefit from—in different ways. Conversely, others feel that the focus on team sports for children does more harm than good. What do you think? Is participation in team sports important for a child's development? Why or why not?
Participation in Team Sports Important f.student_1_response: Of course, children should participate in team sports! Not everyone is a great student. For many children, team sports are a chance to excel and build their confidence. They can recognize the importance of working hard to accomplish a goal, and this can transfer to other aspects of their lives.
Participation in Team Sports Important f.student_2_response: I don't think participating in team sports is always a good thing. One reason is the bad behavior of parents during their children's competitions. Too many parents get overly invested and want to win more than their children do. To that end, they will argue with sports officials and referees and set a bad example for their children.
Participation in Team Sports Important f.folder_name: Participation in Team Sports Important for A Child's Development？

Being An Early Adopter.student_1_response: In my point of view, there are several disadvantages to being an early adopter. Firstly, being a new adopter to always buy the company's newest product can cost a person more money than waiting to buy it later. This is because the new products just launched by the company are usually more expensive, and the price would like to drop along time. For example, the iPhones are about 10 thousand RMB at first since it is brand new with updated designs and functions. However, as more and more people buy it, the marginal profit of the product gets more and more, along with the devaluation of electronic devices due to the fast development of technologies and the fact that the materials it is being made of are consumable. This will lead to a continuous decline in the price of the iPhone. Such is the disadvantage of being an early adopter. Moreover, trying the latest product can contain not only high prices but high risks on the usage experience. The fact that the product is new means whether the product is good or not is uncertain. Therefore, the new adopters could take the risk of getting a terrible product or service at a high cost, which is not worthy at all.

Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.student_1_response: From my perspective, learning English through mobile app is an effective way of learning. To begin with, it's more flexible to learn on mobile app. Nowadays, many people may learn English by taking in-person classes, which requires classmates and teachers to gather around in a specific location, unavoidably costing time on commuting. However, learning online through mobile app could be achieved more easily, because no matter which location we are at, there's nothing that hinders us from learning. People could listen to English recording in the subway with earphones, recite English words while queuing up in a restaurant, and practice speaking in the park. Besides, more advanced technology also render effectiveness for mobile app. Recently, AI or ChatGPT has been prevalent for their astonishing diverse and accurate function. Such tools are incorporated into many mobile apps, which provides high quality of advice on people's learning. People could gain feedback such as the correction in their pronunciation, the revision of grammar problems in their writing and so on. Sometimes those tools' power could be even stronger than human teachers.
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.folder_name: Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign Language

What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that in order for a company to be attractive, it should develop a better working condition for the employees. First, comfortable working condition could help to increase their satisfaction level. For many people nowadays, earning money is no longer the essential goal, when they reach a certain income level the satisfaction they could get from the job is the one that matters. By increasing the working condition, the hygiene factor would be achieved, leading to greater happiness of the employees. The employees would also compare the working environment of all those companies when the salaries they receive is the same amount as from the company with better working condition would be more attractive. Furthermore, having this good working environment could help the old employees to give compliments to the company. When the old employees are satisfied of the working condition they would more likely to suggest the company to other people. This could also cause an increase in the chance of attracting potential employees. 169words
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.folder_name: What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive to Potential Employees

Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.professor_prompt: Today there are many educational computer programs and applications designed to teach people what they want to learn. Many teachers use these developing technologies to help them teach their students, although it is still widely assumed that human teachers have a vital role to play in formal education. Other people believe that human teachers could one day be replaced by extremely sophisticated educational technologies. Which viewpoint do you agree
Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.student_1_response: Computer technologies could actually motivate students even more than human teachers do. Many young people spend hours playing video games, which are really just sophisticated computer programs that challenge a human player with a variety of tasks. If educational applications challenged students in appealing ways, as video games do, they could hold students' interest longer than human teachers do.
Human Teachers Will Be Replaced？.student_2_response: I think it's doubtful that educational technologies could ever satisfactorily replace human teachers in the classroom. An important part of education is motivation to learn. Educational technologies may work well for people who want to learn, but they probably can't motivate students who are bored by a particular subject. An effective human teacher can spark student interest.

Flexible Work Schedules.professor_prompt: Next week, we'll examine some challenges that managers face. One challenge is determining how much independence employees should have. Consider this: many managers give employees the freedom to set their own working hours. For example, an employee might choose to start the workday earlier than is typical. But other managers do not allow flexible schedules, arguing that they create problems. In industries where flexible work schedules are possible, do you think they are a good idea? Why or why not?
Flexible Work Schedules.student_1_response: Flexible schedules are a good idea. For example, they could eliminate the problem of employees being late to work. If people begin work when it best suits their schedule, not only will this benefit the workers, but there will also be no need for supervisors to check every day if all the workers are on time. Everyone will benefit.
Flexible Work Schedules.student_2_response: Claire makes an interesting point, but I'm not convinced. What if the employee's clients or colleagues need access to the employee? If an employee is unavailable at a time of day when most people are doing business, that might be inconvenient and even frustrating for others. That could harm work relationships, which would not be good for the company.

How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.professor_prompt: Starting this week, we are going to discuss the effect that pollution has on our environment. Specifically, we will focus on the pollution of waterways, which has caused significant health problems around the world. Large amounts of plastics, industrial waste, and trash pollute the oceans and rivers. I want you to consider the following question: How much can individuals help solve the water pollution problem compared with large institutions such as corporations and governments? Please explain your position.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.student_1_response: Individual efforts will likely have little effect. It is better to focus on large corporations that do the most damage to our waterways. Think of the oil companies that have spills and factory owners that dump chemicals into the waterways. Individuals pollute the water too, but companies have much more impact. Business leaders need to set examples for the community.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.student_2_response: I think individual people are the first step in solving the pollution problem. For example, when one person stops using harmful chemicals or helps clean up a local waterway, it can inspire others. They can use social media to spread the word and share examples of positive behavior. This can quickly become a grassroots movement for change.
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.folder_name: How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pollution V.S. Large Institution
How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pol.original_image_file: How Much Can Individuals Solve Water Pollution V.S. Large Institution.png

To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.topic: Benefits of To-Do Lists for Task Management
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.professor_prompt: In this discussion, the professor asked students to share their opinions on effective task management strategies. Students were encouraged to discuss whether maintaining to-do lists or other organizational tools help improve productivity and reduce procrastination.
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.student_1_response: I firmly believe that maintaining a to-do list, much like Claire does, is exceptionally beneficial for managing tasks effectively. Writing down tasks not only aids in organizing and prioritizing daily or weekly goals, but it also combats the natural human tendency towards procrastination. Personally, I have noticed a significant improvement in my productivity since I started documenting my tasks. It is true that I do not forget important tasks, which used to be a frequent issue for me. This method also aligns with what I have observed in professional settings: for instance, my father mentions that his company maintains detailed tasks lists, enhancing their overall efficiency. Thus, I advocate for the use of to-do lists as they can be a substantial aid in both academic and professional environments.
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.folder_name: To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Learning and Working？

Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.student_1_response: From my perspective, I believe factories should make more efforts than individuals when it comes to environmental protection. The main reason is that the environmental issues should be counted on industries more than on the individual. The industries could generate million tons of wasted materials and products overnight because of massive production. The quantity of wasted materials being produced is far more numerous than that of individuals. For example, I cannot produce even a pound of junks within a week. However, the volume of wasted materials made by industries can be as massive as a mountain within days. Therefore, as long as the industries undertake the responsibility of protecting environment, the amount of waste can be reduced dramatically. In addition, waste produced by industries is more harmful than that produced by individuals. Many chemical industries generate poisonous substances, which would be poured into rivers for disposal and might turn the whole river into a brown and red liquid line, killing thousands of living organisms, whose existence depends on its living environment.
Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.folder_name: Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts for Environmental Protection

The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.professor_prompt: In the next two weeks, we are going to be studying how biological discoveries have affected our lives. Research in biology provides us with a better understanding of how our bodies work. As an introduction to this topic, I would like for you to discuss among yourselves this question: What is the most important thing a person can do to maintain good health? Please explain why you think so.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.student_1_response: I feel very strongly that a good diet is the most important factor in maintaining good health. Eating good, healthy foods, especially green vegetables, gives your body the materials it needs to stay strong. Good nutrition is the key to good health.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.student_2_response: Most people don't visit the doctor for regular checkups. Sure, if they feel sick, they go, but that's not enough. During a yearly exam, a physician can help a patient address health issues before they become a larger problem. So I think preventive doctor visits are key to good health.
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.folder_name: The Most Important Thing to Maintain Good Health
The Most Important Thing to Maintain Goo.original_image_file: The Most Important Thing to Maintain Good Health.png

Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.student_1_response: In my opinion, online reviews can help me better decide whether I am going to buy the product. First, I can know others using experiences by those comments, and find out whether the product is suitable for me. When there are no online reviews, people can't find a place to refer to others' appraise, so they can only look at the company's descriptions about that product. But in order to attract more customers, a company will usually exaggerate the strength of a product, and ignore the drawbacks. Then, we can't know the comprehensive description of an item, and buy it without knowing the flaws. Second, it can help companies to improve their products and services. If the product has any flaws, consumers are able to point it out directly. According to those comments, the company can better understand consumers' attitudes and willingness, thus improving their products. In this way, their products will be more attractive.
Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.folder_name: Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Products

What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.professor_prompt: Should people donate money to help people in their own country or to help people in other countries?
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.student_1_response: From my perspective, donating money locally would be a better choice. First, donating locally is less likely to cross out of the bound of one's actual financial ability. Donating locally tends to be less costly in comparison to globally because of its smaller range, meaning that money can be used more fully when distributing certain amount of money to a smaller area. In this way, donating locally can be achieved by many people such as college students who take a part-time job, or regular workers who hold strong social responsibility. However, it is always commercial leaders who possess hundreds of wealth would be capable of donating globally which may require the money several times than that of workers gain from his or her whole life. Second, donating locally would have a higher possibility of receiving feedback. Within donors community, their fame would increase because of the donation. When they need help, people would be willing to give a hand. However, donating globally seems too far from donors' lives, and those who benefit from the donation may not even know the name of the donor.
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.student_2_response: In my opinion, donating to international organizations can create a more significant impact. While local donations are convenient, global organizations have the resources and expertise to address large-scale issues like climate change, pandemics, and poverty that transcend national borders. These organizations can pool donations from around the world to fund major projects that no single country could accomplish alone. Additionally, helping people in other countries promotes cross-cultural understanding and global solidarity. While local donations are valuable for immediate community needs, supporting international causes allows us to contribute to solutions that benefit humanity as a whole.
What Factors Should Be Taken into Accoun.folder_name: What Factors Should Be Taken into Account When Choosing Local Or International Charity Organizations

Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.professor_prompt: This week we are talking about how different cities choose to either preserve or replace older, historic buildings. Some cities have strict rules about preserving older buildings and homes, especially those with historic architecture. Others tend to encourage new construction to replace structures that are aging and decaying. Should cities try to save historic buildings or replace them with more modern ones?
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.student_1_response: I think the preservation of old historic buildings involves a lot of problems, especially in densely populated cities. In modern cities, land is very valuable, and old buildings just do not provide as much living and working space as modern high-rise buildings. Also, they were not built to modern standards, so they may waste energy through inefficient heating and cooling.
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.student_2_response: It's important to preserve historic buildings. Keeping original architecture helps preserve a city's culture. Even on the practical side, most big cities get an economic benefit from tourism, and historic buildings like hotels and theaters are big attractions. Who wants to visit a city where all the buildings are glass and steel and look like buildings in every other city?
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.folder_name: Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings
Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.original_image_file: Cities Try to Save Historic Buildings.png

The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.professor_prompt: Next week, we will begin our unit on entrepreneurship. Throughout the world, many people are attracted to the idea of starting a business of their own rather than working for an employer. Naturally, there are benefits to being an entrepreneur, but there are also drawbacks that are important to consider. In your opinion, what is the biggest disadvantage of starting one's own business? Why do you think so?
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.student_2_response: Starting a business often requires a significant sacrifice of time. There is so much that goes into establishing a company or setting up a shop. And even when the business is operational, the work for the owner never ends. Business owners are constantly worried about growing the business and seeking out opportunities. I think the biggest disadvantage of starting a business is that it can be a burden to be in a leadership position on one's own. Most people decide to work in organizations with predictable responsibilities, and they have supervisors who can guide them in problem solving and decision making. Entrepreneurs must figure things out for themselves and are more likely to make mistakes.

Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.professor_prompt: We have recently read in our textbook that local or regional governments often need to reduce the amount of money budgeted in some areas in response to economic shortfalls. For instance, a city council may make the difficult decision to spend less on a certain public service for its residents. Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.student_1_response: My city has a lot of parks that require a lot of upkeep. If there's a need to reduce expenses, the city could make changes to the parks that make them less expensive to maintain. For example, grass lawns, which need to be cut weekly, could be replaced with other plant species that do not need to be cut frequently.
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.student_2_response: Last time I went to City Hall to take care of some business, I saw a lot of employees standing around and doing nothing. I think the local government may be employing too many workers. It was just an impression I had, but I wonder if this is something that should be reviewed.
Local or Regional Government Reducing Sp.folder_name: Local or Regional Government Reducing Spending

Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.topic: Consumer Behavior - Buying Domestic vs Imported Products
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.professor_prompt: Some people prefer to buy certain goods produced outside their own country for various reasons, such as better price, appearance, or quality. While imported goods can offer advantages, the consumer's home country might benefit more if consumers buy products made where they live. Do you think people should try to buy goods made in their own country? Why or why not?
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.student_1_response: Being on a budget, I must purchase products at a lower price, regardless of where they come from. I just bought a phone that works like a name-brand phone but was in my price range; I will purchase whatever product is the best price and has the features I need. So buying goods made outside my country doesn't bother me.
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.student_2_response: Products such as clothing that are made in my country are often more attractive than those made in other places, even if they are a bit more expensive. Buying attractive products made in my country is more satisfying than buying less-expensive goods from abroad. It helps manufacturers in my country, and I really enjoy the look of the clothes.
Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country.folder_name: Buy Goods Made in Their Own Country
