Car-free Central Zones.professor_prompt: In the next few weeks, we'll be talking about urban traffic management. Let's begin by discussing one popular idea—creating car-free central zones. Some cities around the world have recently designated their downtown areas as being automobile-free, which means that vehicles are not allowed to enter the city centers. Do you think that more cities should make their central zones car-free? Why or why not?
Car-free Central Zones.student_1_response: I support the idea of establishing car-free central zones because this will result in one important benefit for city residents—it will be better for their health. Instead of driving everywhere, people will be encouraged to walk or cycle more. It would be a great way to incorporate exercise into people's routines.
Car-free Central Zones.student_2_response: It sounds like a good idea, but I'm skeptical. My main concern is that many businesses located in the city centers, such as shops and restaurants, may suffer because the customers will no longer be able to reach those businesses by car. For some customers, if they can't drive, they won't go at all.

Buying Used Or Recycled Products.topic: Environmental Impact on Consumer Behavior: Buying Used vs New Products
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.professor_prompt: This week in class, we are discussing how concern about the environment is affecting consumer behavior. One recent trend in some countries is that consumers are trying to reuse products and materials as much as possible; for example, by buying used clothing or a used car instead of a new one. In your posts, I want you to discuss either an advantage or a disadvantage of buying used or recycled products as opposed to new ones.
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.student_1_response: Besides the benefits to the environment, one advantage is that many vintage, previously owned products have more charm. For example, old furniture has a lot of character and history, and it always makes a room more interesting. People can even make furniture from reclaimed materials, like making a table from an old wooden door, which always looks unique.
Buying Used Or Recycled Products.student_2_response: Buying used products has its drawbacks. New products are backed by the company that made them. If you buy a new washing machine and it does not work properly, the company will replace or repair it. If you buy something used and it breaks, it's your responsibility to fix it, and the parts are not always available.

The Most Important Thing University Shou.professor_prompt: Last week, we started talking about decisions that university administrators have to make regarding spending. They often need to decide how to allocate their funds, including renovating existing facilities, offering new amenities, and so on. For example, a university could spend money to upgrade a sports stadium, build a new performing arts center, or do a variety of other things. What is the most important thing university administrators should consider when making
The Most Important Thing University Shou.student_1_response: I think the university should get input from its students about what improvement they want to see on their campus. After all, they make up the majority of people who will be attending sporting events at a renovated stadium or live musical and theater performances in a new performing arts center.
The Most Important Thing University Shou.student_2_response: The university needs to consider how much revenue a facility would generate. Building a new facility or renovating an old one would both be very costly, so administrators need to think about which option would bring in the most money in the future. Generating revenue would allow the university to make other improvements to the campus in the future.
The Most Important Thing University Shou.folder_name: The Most Important Thing University Should Consider When Making Spending
The Most Important Thing University Shou.original_image_file: The Most Important Thing University Should Consider When Making Spending.png

Social Media Influencers.professor_prompt: In your opinion, do the things that influencers post on social media have a positive or negative impact on the society we live in today?
Social Media Influencers.student_1_response: In my opinion, influencers on social media generally have a negative impact on the society where we live today. For starters, in order to gain more public attention and view rates, some influencers might do something that might disturb others or even against the laws, which would definitely create terrible influence to the society. For instance, some people might do random interviews on the street, and use cameras to record the process and post it on online platform. Such behavior would disturb other people's daily life and many influencers are posting their videos without any consent. In addition, some people might copy characters from some games such as GTA 5, and they might even try to rob the bank while doing livestreaming, just to obtain more views from the public. Gradually, some teenagers might start imitating those people's actions, seeking for more online exposure and views, which is absolutely not conducive to the development of a social environment.

Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe teacher's salaries should be raised. To begin with, it is known to all that the general salary for teachers is not in the same league as that for other industries such as finance or business. Therefore, many talented people would consider those more profitable occupations when deciding their careers. However, if the overall salary for teachers could be increased, more capable and competitive people would start choosing teachers as their professions. With more experts and professionals in education industry, the quality of students' courses will also be significantly boosted, which would in turn result in better academic performances among students. These students would have a bigger chance to make more valuable contribution to the whole society and make the world a better place. Admittedly, some people believe that spending money on additional resources is a good option, but raising teachers' salaries and encouraging them to do more research and improve their teaching skills would generate far more benefit than buying more advanced computers or books for students.
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.folder_name: Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Additional Resources

Job-Sharing Arrangement.professor_prompt: In recent years, some companies have introduced job-sharing arrangements, in which two employees share the responsibilities of a single full-time position. Do you think this practice is beneficial for both companies and workers?
Job-Sharing Arrangement.student_1_response: In my point of view, job-sharing arrangement is a poor idea in the workforce. First off, such working arrangement might severely hurt companies' profits since it would necessarily decrease employees' working efficiency. Dividing one job into exactly two parts with the same amount of workload is rather difficult to bear, as some more troubles would be able to create between two workers which would decrease one less efficiency.
Job-Sharing Arrangement.student_2_response: I believe that job-sharing arrangements can be very convenient for both companies and workers. For companies, they can attract more talented candidates by offering flexible working options, which can help retain experienced employees who might otherwise leave due to family commitments or other obligations. For workers, job-sharing allows for better work-life balance while still maintaining a professional career and income. This flexibility can lead to higher job satisfaction and reduced stress, ultimately benefiting the company through increased productivity and lower turnover rates.

Excessive Consumption.professor_prompt: We've been discussing the idea that human well-being is not necessarily improved by ever-increasing production and consumption of goods and services. Some people argue that humans already consume too many goods, from clothing to electronics to food; they believe that excessive consumption has created serious problems for humanity and even the planet. Do you agree that excessive consumption--buying more than we truly need--has become a serious problem? Why or why not?
Excessive Consumption.student_1_response: I absolutely agree. We buy far more than we need, and that can't continue indefinitely. For years people have used shopping as a form of recreation. The products bought on a whim are filling up landfills, and the energy expended producing the goods has created a global warming crisis. We should start gradually reducing consumption.
Excessive Consumption.student_2_response: I disagree with the idea that over-consumption is a dramatic problem. I agree there is some over-consumption, but it happens mostly with wealthy people. I think in general almost everyone else already buys only what they need. In fact, many people around the world are not even able to obtain everything they need.

Difference between People from Different.professor_prompt: With so many opportunities to connect nowadays, some people believe that no matter which country we come from, we have more similarities than we have differences. However, others have observed that differences between themselves and people from other countries are growing. In your view, are differences between people from different countries increasing, or are they diminishing? Why?
Difference between People from Different.student_1_response: I think the differences among us are decreasing as our exposure to products from other countries grows. We can enjoy food from any country. We can watch movies made in faraway places. We can go to a store and buy authentic goods from around the world. These things become part of our normal life and make our differences seem smaller.
Difference between People from Different.student_2_response: I understand what Andrew is saying, but for some people, being exposed to differences makes them retreat into their own corner even more. Look at social media. We are exposed to many different people and ideas, but a lot of people talk to only those they agree with and ignore the rest. This only makes the differences between people increase.
Difference between People from Different.folder_name: Difference between People from Different Countries Increasing Or Diminishing？
Difference between People from Different.original_image_file: Difference between People from Different Countries Increasing Or Diminishing？.jpg

Lecturing or Project-based Learning.topic: Education - Project-based Learning vs Traditional Lectures
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.professor_prompt: This week we will be focusing on an instructional approach called project-based learning. In traditional teaching, teachers largely give lectures and ask students questions about the lecture material. But in project-based learning, students acquire and demonstrate knowledge and skills by working on a course-related project, typically with other students. Before our class tomorrow, I'd like your opinion: Do you think project-based learning is more effective at promoting learning than the traditional lecture method?
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.student_1_response: I find the traditional lecture method to be more effective because the information students need to know is given to them directly. In project-based learning, students need to find their own topics and rely on themselves to get information and they might end up missing important information about the topic.
Lecturing or Project-based Learning.student_2_response: I think the process of project-based learning is more effective at helping you develop useful skills, especially interpersonal skills that can be helpful in your career. You can even list the projects you have worked on when applying for a job, which should impress potential employers.

Continual Risks as Business Strategy.professor_prompt: We've been discussing business strategies and the attitudes of businesspeople toward risk and opportunity. The scientist Albert Einstein once said that a person who never made a mistake never tried anything new. He was probably referring to physics, but I wonder how this attitude might apply to the business world. Do you think it is a good business strategy to take continual risks even though they might result in mistakes that could affect a company negatively?
Continual Risks as Business Strategy.student_1_response: I think this strategy can easily backfire on a businessperson. I've seen companies conduct endless cycles of product enhancements in an effort to capture some other market share. But in reality, they just damage their own brand by sacrificing too much of the original content that made the product popular in the first place.
Continual Risks as Business Strategy.student_2_response: I disagree with Paul. Most profitable businesses have used this strategy, or they would have never made it to the top. If you try to grow a business aggressively, some mistakes along the way are inevitable. Too much caution or too much emphasis on avoiding mistakes can really prevent growth.

Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be discussing ways in which schools can help expose their students (aged 5-18) to learning experiences beyond the classroom. Let's begin by discussing one popular idea that some schools are considering—offering outdoor classes once a month. On the day of outdoor classes, students will be transported to local parks or nature preserves, and teachers can help students explore nature and learn about the environment. Do you think this is a good idea?
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.student_1_response: Having outdoor classes once a month seems like an exciting way of providing students with interesting hands-on experiences. However, I don't think these classes would be a worthwhile use of instructional time and of school resources. These classes could put substantial pressure on schools' financial resources and on teachers, who may have to redesign their lesson plans.
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.student_2_response: Outdoor classes can increase students' motivation for learning about interconnectedness in the natural world. These classes could be great opportunities to teach students about dire environmental problems, such as pollution, and ways of addressing these problems. It will deepen their understanding beyond what books could do and would be time well spent.
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.folder_name: Students Exploring Nature and Learning about Environment
Students Exploring Nature and Learning a.original_image_file: Students Exploring Nature and Learning about Environment.png

Take Breaks from Reading Or Watching New.student_1_response: In my opinion, it is beneficial for people to take breaks from all the different news. First, it can reduce people's anxiety and stress levels. With the development of technology, many different kinds of news appear in people's daily lives. People are also being exposed to numerous negative news reports every day, which will easily affect people's moods and contribute to their stress and anxiety. Taking a break allows individuals to disconnect from the constant flow of information, and prioritize their mental well-being. In this way, they can be well prepared for new pieces of information they are facing, and reduce mental stress. Second, it can also improve people's productivity. News consumption is usually time-consuming, taking a break from reading news allows people to have more free time, and they can spend that time with more valuable uses to improve efficiency and productivity.
Take Breaks from Reading Or Watching New.folder_name: Take Breaks from Reading Or Watching News

Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.professor_prompt: We have read studies that explain the negative impact of social media on both children and adults. Many believe that social media will remain widely used in the future, since it is both popular and useful in some contexts, but because of the problems it poses, it should be regulated in some way. In your opinion, should governments regulate social media platforms, or should social media companies regulate their platforms themselves? Why do you think so?
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.student_1_response: I believe social media companies should regulate themselves. There are plenty of social media platforms on the market, so the competition is tough. For example, to appeal to parents, a social media platform could publicize that they have stringent regulations for children's use of the platform, and in this way it could attract more users who care about children's safety.
Governments Or Companies Regulate Social.student_2_response: Social media companies should be taking an active role in combatting the negative effects, but that is not really happening. I hear many stories of false information spreading around, sometimes causing irreparable damage to people's reputations. Therefore, the government should put stricter regulations on the companies, and they should be punished for not following the rules.

Do many possissions actually drecrease q.professor_prompt: While owning lots of consumer products is believed to increase the quality of life, these products can also impose responsibilities on those who own them. For these reasons, some people argue that having many possessions can actually decrease the quality of life. Do you agree or disagree? Why?
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.student_1_response: I totally agree that an excess of possessions can drag down our quality of life. Just think about the time we spend organizing closets or garages. I spend hours every month sorting and storing clothes in my closet. This clutter and the time it takes to manage it can become overwhelming and detract from enjoying life.
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.student_2_response: Just the thought of having to constantly worry about my gadgets, or even my car, needing maintenance gives me anxiety. It's like adding extra homework to life. Life often requires owning many things, but personally, I hate having to keep track of them all or worry about them getting damaged or broken.
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.folder_name: Do many possissions actually drecrease quality of life

Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.topic: Shopping at Small Local Stores vs Superstores
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.student_1_response: From my perspective, I don't think it's more beneficial for people to shop at small local stores rather than at superstores. To begin with, the local supermarket usually closes early, so its opening hours are not long enough to meet the requirements of most people. For instance, small local supermarkets are usually run by individuals, so we cannot guarantee that the shops will be open all day. Although some small supermarkets have a better service, just imagine, when we go to the small stores at midnight with no one to help, it would be even more inconvenient. In contrast, superstores not only operate all day, but also help us solve problems better since they have more staff to provide necessary aid for consumers. On top of that, superstores usually have a variety of goods. When people shop in a large supermarket, they usually buy more than they need to use. In that case, it decreases the number of times they go shopping, thus, reducing their
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.folder_name: Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstores

Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.topic: Mobile Phone Age Limit for Children
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.professor_prompt: This week we covered different parenting styles. One idea we discussed was how much independence and freedom we should give our children, especially young children. One related issue is whether there should be an age limit on when children can have mobile phones. In this discussion post, I would like you to discuss whether you agree or disagree with the idea of setting a minimum age for when children can have a mobile phone. Explain your opinion.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.student_1_response: I totally agree with the idea of not giving children phones before they reach a certain age, let's say ten years or so. I believe children younger than ten are not yet ready to deal with the world that comes with mobile phones, as it can put them in harm's way.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.student_2_response: Honestly, I am against the idea of restricting mobile phone access for young children. I believe mobile phones can help children communicate with their parents if they need their help for an urgent matter when they are away from their parents at school or elsewhere. Maybe companies can invent a special kind of mobile phone that is somehow kid friendly.
Setting A Minimum age for Children to Ha.folder_name: Setting A Minimum age for Children to Have Mobile Phones

Four-day Workweek.professor_prompt: What is your opinion on reducing the work week into a shorter week?
Four-day Workweek.student_1_response: I totally agree with the idea of having a four-day workweek. To begin with, shorter working hours can give people time to relax and promote the happiness index of residents in such a stressful world. Personally, I will choose to spend that spare time with my family or devote it for my hobbies, and doing this will surely ease my anxiety. Moreover, it will also promote a relaxed atmosphere in the workplace leading to a better work experience and results. Some people might say doing the same amount of work within four days will cause an increase on people's working pressure on every single work day. However, the four-day workweek will lead to a higher working efficiency on each work day. And efficiency is what people admire the most in such high pace world life, not to mention the pressure mentioned above can be easily compensated by the weekend with an extra day.

Pursuing Degree Full-time Or Continuing.student_1_response: In my opinion, I prefer to enroll in a full-time degree. First of all, a full-time degree can make us more competitive when we search for jobs. After we completed an advanced degree, our advanced expertise and ability to complete hard tasks in the filed we study, which are abilities that favored by the employers, would be guaranteed. As a result, we are more likely to be recruited by a better company with a higher salary, and we will have enough money to do other thing, like tour. However, if we choose to take a job before completing an advanced degree, we will be less competitive comparing to others who have completed their degrees, which means that we might end up with an undesirable job. In addition, taking a job will disturb our studies as well, since we can no longer put our full time into our studies.
Pursuing Degree Full-time Or Continuing.folder_name: Pursuing Degree Full-time Or Continuing Work and Studying Part-time

Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.professor_prompt: This week we talked about how important taking time off from work or school is for people's well-being. Some people believe they get the most benefit when that time off is structured; that is, it involves planning in advance about what will be accomplished on that day. Others believe it is better to enjoy the day with no plan for how to spend it. In this discussion post, please indicate which of those approaches to spending time off from work or school you prefer, and why.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.student_1_response: I find it beneficial to do some advance planning for my free time. I live far away from my family, so when I am getting ready to visit them during a school holiday, I always plan my time off from school very carefully. That way I have enough time to visit with each family member.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.student_2_response: Personally, I prefer not to make any plans for my free time. I go to school, and I have a part-time job, and each week I make a schedule to be sure I can complete both my work and my studies. So when I have time off from work and school, I just want to relax with no plan.
Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work o.folder_name: Make Plans to Spend Time off from Work or School

Students Should Be Allowed to Choose The.topic: Students Choosing Their Own Field of Study at University
Students Should Be Allowed to Choose The.student_1_response: In my opinion, | believe that students who are currently studying in secondary school should not be allowed to choose their own field of study at university without any guide from parents or teachers. To begin with, many secondary students do not have a clear picture as to different field of studies, whereas teachers or parents, who are more experienced than young adolescents, would be equipped with more information and thus are able to make better choice. For example, professional teachers would know the future careers of studying different field, and they would thus inform students what it would be like in the future if they choose certain majors, helping them to understand the bigger picture. Besides, many parents would have a better understanding regarding their children's strength, making their adivce on students' future majors far more useful and valuable. Therefore, secondary students should consult their parents or teachers about their future majors.
Students Should Be Allowed to Choose The.folder_name: Students Should Be Allowed to Choose Their Own Field of Study

Motivating Young Students：Activities, Or.student_1_response: In my opinion, teachers should emphasize interesting, hands-on activities to make learning a fun thing. To start with, it can save money for teachers and schools. As time passes, the price value today keeps increasing. It is important now to spend money with the highest efficiency. If teachers need to give students extra treats, they will have a lot of extra spending on buying those treats, which might let teachers have a negative impression on teaching. In this way, the teacher's teaching quality might decrease, and have a negative impact on students' academic performance. Also, when students need extra play time, the number of teachers might not be enough so the school needs to hire extra teachers, which will be another expense. In contrast, giving students interesting and hands-on activities doesn't cost extra money, and schools can save those spending on more valuable approaches.

Watching Sports Or Following Their Favor.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that it could have a negative effect on their lives. To begin with, many people would develop this addiction which could lead to more trouble due to the amount of time they spend on it. In modern society, it is easy for people to develop an addiction and be unaware of it due to the development of technology. Many people would sit on the sofa watching sports for the whole day and not feeling tired, which is a really bad habit. This unawareness could lead to conflict between families because they don't spend time with them; lack of exercise due to the amount of time they spend watching sports; or extreme expenditure like buying extreme amounts of sports events tickets. All of those would further damage them physically, financially, and socially. Furthermore, having this extreme affection toward sport could also cause conflict between people. Because many sports fans are quite extreme sometimes due to this strong support for their team, they could have conflicts with fans of other teams. This could lead to very extreme actions like riots and physical combats, that could damage the countries' reputation and individuals' health.
Watching Sports Or Following Their Favor.folder_name: Watching Sports Or Following Their Favorite Team

Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.professor_prompt: Last class, we started talking about how almost anyone today can write and post news articles to a Web site or even host a news podcast. People no longer need a degree in journalism or a professional connection to a news outlet to express their views and ideas to a wide audience. Some people believe this development negatively affects the field of journalism as well as consumers of news. Do you agree with this viewpoint? Why or why not?
Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.student_1_response: I do worry that people practicing journalism without professional training can actually harm others. Journalism courses in universities really emphasize the importance of checking facts and doing thorough research. I am concerned that someone who has not been taught journalistic standards may mislead readers in potentially harmful ways.
Journalism Being Negatively Affected？.student_2_response: In the past, there was a much more limited range of views expressed in newspapers and other publications. I think we benefit today because many different points of view are expressed on social media. While journalistic standards on the Internet may not always be high, at least readers get to hear stories that might not otherwise be told.

The Most Important Factor for Employer t.student_1_response: From my perspective, the most important factor for employers to consider when deciding where employees should work is the time cost. The main reason is that time determines profits. When office is too far from employees' home, they may have to spend hours on commuting, which means they may have to get up quite early if employers requires them to reach the company, and that is an obviously unreasonable option. Under that situation and considering the time cost, employers would find that allowing employees to work at home would enable companies to produce more each day because employees receive more rest by saving the time spent on traveling long distance to the company, prompting their working efficiency. In this way, the whole company could be more productive, increasing the profit.
The Most Important Factor for Employer t.folder_name: The Most Important Factor for Employer to Consider When Deciding where Employees Should Work
